description: Our discussion of linear inequalities begins with multiplying and dividing by negative numbers. Listen closely for the word "swap." Super important!
title: One-step inequalities examples

description: In addition to solving the inequality, we'll graph the solution. Remember to swap if you mutiply both sides of the inequality by a negative number.
title: One-step inequalities: -5c ≤ 15

description: Inequalities are more than abstract concepts and exercises. They help solve real life problems. Here's an example.
title: One-step inequality word problem

description: Practice solving inequalities in one step.
title: One-step inequalities

description: We're turning up the heat a little and asking you to help us solve a multi-step inequality problem.
title: Two-step inequalities

description: Sal solves several multi-step linear inequalities.
title: Multi-step inequalities

description: Sal solves the inequality 5x+7>3(x+1), draws the solution on a number line and checks a few values to verify the solution.
title: Inequalities with variables on both sides (with parentheses)

description: Sal solves the inequality -3p-7<p+9, draws the solution on a number line and checks a few values to verify the solution.
title: Inequalities with variables on both sides

description: Solve linear inequalities that take multiple steps to solve.
title: Multi-step linear inequalities

description: We'll talk you through this fun and challenging inequality problem.
title: Two-step inequality word problem: apples

description: Learn how to solve an inequality word problem about cell phone texting plans.
title: Two-step inequality word problem: texting

description: Let's tackle this word problem together. We'll interpret the information and then construct a linear inequality to solve it.
title: Two-step inequality word problem: R&B

description: Practice constructing, interpreting, and solving linear inequalities that model real-world situations.
title: Two-step inequality word problems
